intro: Atriplex altaica, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of Asia and North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, often spiny leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and saline environments, making it a common weed in disturbed soils. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Its ability to reproduce both sexually and vegetatively contributes to its invasive potential in new habitats.
